medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient noticed unsteadiness while walking down stairs at 36 years old. His walking disorder progressively worsened, leading to a visit to the neurology department at age 39. Due to further progression of gait disturbance, he began using a walker at 51 years old. Cognitive function declined with age, with HDS-R scores of 28, 20, and 18 at ages 39, 50, and 55 respectively.
medical_history.family_history: The patient was born to a consanguineous marriage; his parents were healthy with no family history of neurological diseases.
